channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1821] People Who Bought Jon & Kate + Ei8ght Also Bought... [pic]
item.description: Looks like Amazon customers don't take too kindly to thereality series.

item.title: [+1492] BP Photoshops Another Official Image, Again Terribly
item.description: This week it came to light that BP had photoshopped -poorly- another official image of their crisis command center. Apparently, that wasn't an isolated incident. Let's take a closer look at this view from a helicopter, shall we?

item.title: [+1109] xkcd: All the Girls
[+1098] Most Clever Jewelry Billboard Ever [pic]
[+987] Darth Vader Robs Bank (Photos, Oh Yes, Photos) - Gothamist
item.description: A man wearing a Darth Vader mask and cape robbed a Long Island bank.

item.title: [+891] FCC Now Defines Broadband As 4 Mbps
item.description: For over a decade, the standard has been set at 200 kilobits per second downstream, but the FCC now puts it at 4 Mbits/s downstream and 1 Mbits/s upstream.

item.title: [+877] Awesome Parrot Does 20 Tricks In Two Minutes (Video)
item.description: So it turns out birds aren't as effective as puppies in attracting women, but look what he did with all of that extra free time!

item.title: [+711] Sarah Palin's Geography Song: 'Fifty Nifty States' (VIDEO)
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel's been having a field day recently with Sarah Palin. After taking on her tendency to ignore the dictionary, Kimmel mocked her last night for her repeated geography gaffes, the most recent of which was not knowing that Hawaii is the nation's largest island.

item.title: [+595] Build a $200 Linux PC
item.description: If you need a second or third computer but money is tight, you don't need to buy a full system. You can build a surprisingly speedy Linux PC that will excel at everyday tasks, and cost less than $200.

item.title: [+583] Sen. John Kerry (D-MA) skips town on sails tax
item.description: Sen. John Kerry, who has repeatedly voted to raise taxes while in Congress, dodged a whopping six-figure state tax bill on his new multimillion-dollar yacht by mooring her in Newport, R.I.

item.title: [+553] ‘Yes Men’ Use BitTorrent To Avoid Censorship
item.description: The Yes Men are a culture jamming activist duo who expose the lies and social problems caused by governments and corporations. In their much awarded films they impersonate people in power to bring out the truth. Because the US Chamber of Commerce is suing their asses, they have now turned to BitTorrent to get their message out.

item.title: [+543] Despite Digg's Man Crush, Old Spice Guy Not Helping Sales
item.description: Isaiah Mustafa -- the actor portraying the now-ubiquitous "Old Spice Guy" -- and his perfect example of the male body have done wonders for Internet traffic while squashing the egos of mere mortal men across the world. Unfortunately, there's one thing that the Red Zone After Hours Body Wash ad campaign has thus far failed to achieve

item.title: [+516] USA doing 'Burn Notice' prequel starring Bruce Campbell
[+508] 3 Out of Every 4 Oil & Gas Lobbyists Worked for Federal Gov.
item.description: Key lobbying hires include 18 former members of Congress and dozens of former presidential appointees. For other senior management positions, the industry employs two former directors of the Minerals Management Service, the since-renamed agency that regulates the industry, and several top officials from the Bush White House.

item.title: [+507] The Vicious Circle Of Work & Sleep [Comic]
[+487] Classic game characters: then and now
item.description: Comparing nearly 30 years of gaming history against itself

item.title: [+484] Salary Outrage Prompts Resignations in LA Suburb
item.description: Three Administrators of Blue-Collar Bell, Calif., Agree to Step Down; Highest-Paid Made More than $787K. Rizzo was the highest paid at $787,637 a year - nearly twice the pay of President Barack Obama - for overseeing one of the poorest towns in Los Angeles County.Spaccia makes $376,288 a year and Adams earns $457,000, 50 percent more than Los Ange

item.title: [+480] The Photo That Brought AIDS Home
item.description: In November, 1990, LIFE magazine published a photograph of a young man, David Kirby -- his body wasted by AIDS, his gaze locked on something beyond this world -- surrounded by anguished family members as he took his last breaths. The haunting image of Kirby's passing became the one photograph most identified with the HIV/AIDS epidemic.

item.title: [+472] iPad Shirt Is Literally the Ugliest Thing Ever (PICS)
item.description: Syte Shirt, a new startup with a vision to change the world in a way you've never even dreamed of, has just announced its first product: the iPad-toting shirt.

item.title: [+456] Sarah Palin Facebook Post Deleted, Social Network Apologizes
item.description: Not only is she an avid tweeter, but Sarah Palin also regularly uses Facebook to post "notes."But Palin's latest post, which discussed the mosque that is set to be built near Ground Zero in New York City, had some problems. The note, entitled, "An Intolerable Mistake On Hallowed Ground," was deleted by Facebook.
